thread.title: GameDay to Philly for No. 21 Temple vs. No. 9 Notre Dame
thread.title_full: GameDay to Philly for No. 21 Temple vs. No. 9 Notre Dame

title: GameDay to Philly for No. 21 Temple vs. No. 9 Notre Dame
text:
GameDay to Philly for No. 21 Temple vs. No. 9 Notre Dame By - Associated Press   
PHILADELPHIA (AP) - ESPN’s “College GameDay” will broadcast from Independence Mall in Philadelphia on Saturday as No. 21 Temple hosts No. 9 Notre Dame in one of the most significant games in the school’s history. 
The network announced the decision Monday after deliberating for a day longer than usual. Pullman, Washington, where No. 8 Stanford is playing Washington State, was a possible contender. 
Temple students, alumni and fans lobbied ESPN on social media after the upstart Owls rallied in the fourth quarter last Thursday to beat East Carolina for its first ever 7-0 start. 
Temple-Notre Dame is the only matchup of ranked opponents this weekend. It’s Temple’s first appearance in ABC’s primetime game of the week. 
The only previous “GameDay” broadcast from Philadelphia was Nov. 16, 2002 for the Harvard-Penn game. The hometown Quakers won 44-9.
